hackathon-description-text: Welcome to the HackBU hackathon, Binghamton University's second annual hackathon! We hope you're excited for a great weekend! After 8:00 p.m. on Friday, all teams are allowed to start working on their hacks. Hacking will end on 8:00 a.m. on Sunday morning, with all submissions due by 9:00 a.m.

hackathon-judges.judge-role: Computer Science Professor at Binghamton University
Associate Director, Strategic Employer Outreach, Fleishman Center for Career and Professional Development at Binghamton University

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: Dell Venue tablet and mystery prize for each team member, $100 team dinner, $100 Shapeways credit.
Jambox mini and mystery prize for each team member, $100 Shapeways credit.
Amazon Fire Stick and mystery prize for each team member, $100 Shapeways credit.
Pebble Steels for each team member.
The winning team will receive a 500GB Dell Portable Hard Drive.
Leap Motion Controller and mystery prize for each team member.
Mystery prize for each team member, $100 Shapeways credit.
Three months of TreeHouse (teamtreehouse.com) for each team member.

hackathon-location-google-maps: https://maps.google.com/?q=Binghamton University, 85 Murray Hill Road, Vestal, NY 13850, USA

hackathon-judging-criteria.judging-criterion:
Is the product functional?
Does it accomplish its goal?
Does it work as is, or does it require additional resources (code or data)?
How easy is the product to use?
How does the product look and feel?

How technically difficult was the hack to implement?
How much did it rely on open source libraries and APIs?

Is this a creative solution to a problem?
Is this a new solution to a problem?
Does the product innovate on design, user experience, or technical solutions?

hackathon-location-address: Binghamton University, 85 Murray Hill Road, Vestal, NY 13850, USA
hackathon-description-header: Join 300 hackers at Binghamton University from March 20–22 for 36 hours of hacking.
